description:
From Healthcare Facilities Licensing & Accreditation Department to All Private Healthcare Facilities in Qatar: 

It is strictly prohibited to advertise products which have not been scientifically proven to cure COVID-19 on any type of social media. Anyone who violates this will be liable for legal action.

On April 20, Dr. Karim Mohamed Darwish, Head of Arabic Language Technologists at the Qatar Computing Research Institute at Hamad Bin Khalifa University, revealed the design of a technical platform that monitors fake news and rumors being promoted via social media or in the visual media about the emerging Coronavirus (Covid-19).

Dr. Darwish said that the Qatar Computing Research Institute is cooperating with the Ministry of Public Health in Qatar to support its efforts to combat the epidemic by providing periodic reports on the most prominent rumors circulating about the virus (anti-disinformation measure).

Darwish explained that the technical platform includes two applications, namely, "Alert" and "Falcon", noting that one of them specializes in monitoring rumors that are being promoted through social media, and the other is specialized in monitoring fake news in the visual media.

description:
Ms. Fawzia Abdulaziz Al Khater, Assistant Undersecretary for Educational Affairs at the Ministry of Education and Higher Education (MOEHE), has announced the end of distance learning on 7 May 2020 for students of grades 1 to 11. She emphasized that MOEHE has been keen to end the distance learning after ensuring that student has completely received the study material of the remaining second semester. This is in order for student to move to a higher grade in the upcoming school year without any negative impacts on student’s academic achievement. 

Al Khater said that the State of Qatar has invested in education; therefore, schools have had a strong infrastructure that has enabled the Ministry to apply the distance learning system shortly and very efficiently. She made clear that 350 teachers have been assigned to produce videoed lessons for all school levels, and that 100 halls have been allocated to produce lessons as quickly as needed, as well as showing flexibility in the distance-learning schedule.

"The Ministry of Public Health is seeking volunteers to support Qatar’s response to the COVID-19 outbreak.

​The National Volunteering Campaign: For Qatar has been organized around March 24 to ease the strain on Qatar’s resources during the pandemic. Volunteers will initially be required over the next three months.

Volunteers’ responsibilities will include supporting medical practice, raising public health awareness, logistics and more. They will be based at medical facilities across the country.

We need to stand together as a community and work to support Qatar’s public and private sectors during these trying times.”

Volunteers must meet the below criteria:

Be a Qatar resident 
Have Qatar ID
Aged 20-45
Be medically fit enough to contribute
No history of chronic illness/disease
​Suitable volunteers will attend a two-hour induction session plus a two-hour job-specific training session before proceeding with their duties. Volunteers will be needed for at least 14 eight-hour shifts over a 12-week period. All volunteers will be provided with suitable personal protective equipment. People already working in the healthcare sector are welcome to take part.

Volunteers are encouraged to apply as quickly as possible."

description: On April 21, 2020, Qatar's Ministry of Endowment and Islamic Affairs (Awqaf) said it will implement its Ramadan programs this year via electronic platforms affiliated with the Ministry or via the known social media websites, such as Facebook, Twitter and Instagram on the Ministry’s account. This is in the light of the full closure of the mosques in the State of Qatar as a precautionary measure to curb the spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19). His Eminence Sheikh Malallah Al Jabir, Director of  Department of Da'wah and Religious Guidance affiliated with Awqaf, has said that the Ministry has been prepared to implement a number of Da’wah (preaching Islam) and awareness programs, since the Ministry has been keen to implement these distance programs by using technology and integrated electronic system.
